oai_dc:dc.dc:title: FINAL STEP IN LOS ANGELES ANIMAL REGULATIONS APPROACHING
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Jennings, Jerry
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: TheÂ· L.A. City Council Planning Committeeapproved, without dissent, amotion to accept the Planning Commission'srecommendation to limit only thenumber of cows on RA city lots, andleave birds alone.The history of the ordinance coversnearly two years of activity, when aproposal to ban birds and other animalsfrom the city was introduced in June1974. Strong opposition from A.F.A. andRURAL, a local animal owning, homeowner'sassociation, led to several changesthat free aviculturists and would-begentlemen farmers from potential harrassment.The next and final step will betaken when the full council votes on theissue in the near future.
